title: Who discovered the Dominican Republic? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the island were stablished the first indigenous people we call Tainos. They were the indigenous habitants of the Caribbean. Later Christopher Columbus would met them for the second time at the island of Santo Domingo (now divided into Dominican Republic and Haití), December 5,of 1492. Columbus was looking for an alternative route to the india, looking for supply for Spain, found a supply of gold in the Caribbean instead Spanish settled and conquered the island, where some of them mixed with the Tainos, but indigenous population decayed quickly, leading to the indigenous people go extinct.

Dominican Republic was founded on February 27, 1844, after a group of young men and their supporters declared independence from Haiti. The lands that currently makes up the Dominican Republic had been taken over from the Taino[1] people by the Spanish Kingdom since 1492, who were part of the Arawak[2] indigenous people that were present in the northern part of South America.
